item.title: Graph Embeddings on a Personal Scale
item.description:
Tech giants build graphs on a vast scale to power products.

Embedding models typically are constructed at scale, with huge amounts of information. Is it possible to construct such information spaces on a personal scale?

TransE embeddings are efficient.

Experiment Setup

Two paths, one with random initialization, one with partial text embedding initialization.

Data

For data, we’re using a mix of works by Edgar Allen Poe, Sonnets by William Shakespeare, and light biographical information each author pulled for Wikipedia. This amounts to a knowledge graph that consists of:
